revised_title: Investigation of Co-ordination in Copper Compounds: Absorption Spectra and Co-ordination of Copper Derivatives
tldr: This study investigates the co-ordination and absorption spectra of various copper compounds, including copper acetylacetone and copper salts of fatty acids. The researchers found that the absorption spectra of these compounds are dependent on the nature of the anion or co-ordinated radical. They also discovered that the ultra-violet absorption bands of copper derivatives of diketones and fatty acids differ, with the former showing distinct bands and the latter not showing any ultra-violet bands.
